## Practice plotting with your dataset

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

ggplot(data = CPP, aes(x = Manufacturer, y = Price)) +
  geom_point()
  
  
##Practicesubsetting data
# use a combination of
# filter, select, mutate, arrange, summarize, group_by, sample, and/or slice
# create a visualization using your new subset of data

```{r}
View(CPP)
names(CPP)

CPP %>%
  filter(Price >= 1000) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Price)) +
    geom_histogram()

ggplot(CPP, aes(x = Mileage)) +
  geom_bar()

CPP %>%
  filterData <- filter(CPP, Model == "Civic" , Category == "Sedan" , Color == "Black")
  filter2Data <- filter(CPP, Model == "Prius" , Category == "Sedan" , Color == "Black")
  filterData
  filter2Data
  ggplot(data = filterData, aes(x = `Fuel type`, fill = "Red")) +
    geom_bar()
  ggplot(data = filter2Data, aes(x = `Fuel type`, fill = "Blue")) +
    geom_bar()


CPP %>%
  filter(Price >= 100, Model == "Civic") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Model, y = Price)) +
    geom_bar()

           
```
